senses.sense_definition: Having the capability or tendency to cause dispersion, such as separating light into colors or spreading particles.

examples.text: The glass prism has a <w>dispersive</w> effect that splits white light into a rainbow.
Scientists calculated the <w>dispersive</w> power of the new optical material.

senses.sense_definition: Tending to break apart, dissolve, or scatter into smaller particles itself; often used to describe unstable soils.

examples.text: Building on <w>dispersive</w> soil can be dangerous because the ground erodes easily when wet.
The engineer identified <w>dispersive</w> clay in the sample, which required specific treatment.
